terms.name: ComplianceFramework
terms.description: A regulatory or industry compliance framework that defines security and governance controls for cloud environments, such as MCSB, NIST 800-53, or ISO 27001
terms.usageExample: MCSB v2 framework containing 90+ security controls across 12 domains
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing a complete compliance standard that contains multiple controls
terms.businessMeaning: The regulatory standard an organization must comply with based on industry, geography, or contractual requirements
terms.technicalMeaning: A JSON-LD DefinedTermSet containing structured control definitions with implementation guidance and audit evidence requirements
terms.constraints: Must have unique frameworkId, version must follow semantic versioning
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use frameworks to determine which controls apply to a given resource or subscription, and to calculate compliance scores
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph LR
    CF[ComplianceFramework] -->|contains| CC[ComplianceControl]
    CA[ComplianceAssessment] -->|covers| CF
```

terms.name: ComplianceControl
terms.description: A specific security or governance requirement within a compliance framework that can be implemented and audited, such as NS-1 Network Segmentation or DP-3 Encryption in Transit
terms.usageExample: MCSB NS-1 requiring network segmentation between application tiers
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing a specific auditable requirement within a framework
terms.businessMeaning: A specific rule or requirement that must be satisfied to achieve compliance with a framework
terms.technicalMeaning: A DefinedTerm with controlId, controlFamily, and implementationGuidance properties defining what must be configured
terms.constraints: controlId must be unique within framework, description minimum 20 characters
terms.relationships: Belongs to Framework (1..1), Maps to ControlMapping (0..*), Implemented by ControlImplementation (1..*), Violated by Finding (0..*), Addresses SectorRequirement (0..*)
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents evaluate controls against resource configurations to determine compliance status and generate findings
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph TB
    CF[Framework] -->|contains| CC[Control]
    CC -->|mapsTo| CM[Mapping]
    CC -->|implementedBy| CI[Implementation]
    CFi[Finding] -->|violates| CC
```

terms.name: ControlMapping
terms.description: A mapping relationship between equivalent controls across different compliance frameworks enabling cross-framework compliance assessment
terms.usageExample: MCSB NS-1 maps to NIST SC-7 with 'exact' mapping strength
terms.usageContext: Use when establishing equivalence between controls in different frameworks to reduce audit burden
terms.businessMeaning: Documentation that satisfying one control also satisfies equivalent controls in other frameworks
terms.technicalMeaning: A PropertyValue linking sourceControl to targetControl with mappingStrength enum (exact/partial/related)
terms.constraints: Must connect two different controls, mappingStrength required
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use mappings to calculate unified compliance scores across multiple frameworks and identify coverage gaps
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph LR
    CC1[MCSB NS-1] -->|mapsTo| CM[ControlMapping]
    CM -->|connectsTo| CC2[NIST SC-7]
```

terms.name: AzureResource
terms.description: An Azure cloud resource that can be configured and audited for compliance with security controls, such as a Storage Account, Key Vault, or Virtual Network
terms.usageExample: Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts resource in subscription with TLS 1.2 enabled
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing any Azure resource that needs compliance evaluation
terms.businessMeaning: A deployed cloud service or component that must meet security and governance requirements
terms.technicalMeaning: An Azure Resource Manager resource with resourceId, resourceType, resourceProvider, and configuration properties
terms.constraints: resourceId must be valid ARM resource ID format, resourceType from Azure provider namespace
terms.relationships: Evaluated in Assessment (0..*), Affected by Finding (0..*), Implementation applies to (1..*)
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents query Resource Graph for resource inventory and evaluate configurations against control requirements
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph TB
    CI[Implementation] -->|appliesTo| AR[AzureResource]
    AR -->|evaluatedIn| CA[Assessment]
    CFi[Finding] -->|affects| AR
```

terms.name: ControlImplementation
terms.description: The specific Azure configuration or policy that implements a compliance control for a resource type
terms.usageExample: Azure Policy requiring TLS 1.2 minimum on Storage Accounts implements MCSB DP-3
terms.usageContext: Use when documenting how a control is technically implemented in Azure
terms.businessMeaning: The technical mechanism that enforces or validates a compliance requirement
terms.technicalMeaning: An Action with azurePolicyId, configurationProperty, expectedValue, and remediationAction
terms.constraints: Must reference valid Azure Policy definition ID or configuration property path
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use implementations to determine expected configurations and identify non-compliant resources
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph LR
    CC[Control] -->|implementedBy| CI[Implementation]
    CI -->|appliesTo| AR[Resource]
```

terms.name: ComplianceAssessment
terms.description: A point-in-time evaluation of an Azure environment against compliance controls producing a compliance score and findings
terms.usageExample: Pre-ALZ audit assessing MCSB v1 and v2 compliance across 3 subscriptions
terms.usageContext: Use when performing a compliance evaluation of an Azure environment
terms.businessMeaning: A formal evaluation of security posture against compliance requirements at a specific point in time
terms.technicalMeaning: A Dataset containing assessmentDate, assessmentScope (subscription IDs), frameworksAssessed, overallScore, and findingsCount
terms.constraints: Must cover at least one framework, overallScore 0-100, findingsCount non-negative integer
terms.relationships: Covers Framework (1..*), Evaluates Resource (0..*), Produces Finding (0..*)
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents orchestrate assessments by running KQL queries, evaluating resources, and calculating compliance scores
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph TB
    CA[Assessment] -->|covers| CF[Framework]
    AR[Resource] -->|evaluatedIn| CA
    CA -->|produces| CFi[Finding]
```

terms.name: ComplianceFinding
terms.description: A specific non-compliance issue identified during assessment with severity and remediation guidance
terms.usageExample: Storage Account lacking TLS 1.2 enforcement violating MCSB DP-3 with High severity
terms.usageContext: Use when documenting a specific compliance gap that requires remediation
terms.businessMeaning: A documented instance where a resource fails to meet a compliance requirement
terms.technicalMeaning: A Report with findingSeverity (critical/high/medium/low/informational), currentState, expectedState, and remediationGuidance
terms.constraints: findingSeverity required from enum, remediationPriority 1-5 integer
terms.relationships: From Assessment (1..1), Violates Control (1..1), Affects Resource (1..1)
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents generate findings by comparing resource configurations against control requirements and prioritize remediation
terms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph LR
    CA[Assessment] -->|produces| CFi[Finding]
    CFi -->|violates| CC[Control]
    CFi -->|affects| AR[Resource]
```

terms.name: InsuranceSectorRequirement
terms.description: A regulatory requirement specific to the insurance sector that must be addressed through cloud compliance controls
terms.usageExample: FCA SYSC 13.9 requiring firms to ensure IT security for outsourced services
terms.usageContext: Use when mapping insurance-specific regulations to technical controls
terms.businessMeaning: A legal or regulatory obligation specific to insurance firms that drives compliance requirements
terms.technicalMeaning: A GovernmentService with regulatoryBody (FCA/PRA/Lloyd's/EIOPA/ICO), applicableRegulation, and enforcementDate
terms.constraints: regulatoryBody must be from defined enum, requirementId unique
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents map sector requirements to technical controls to ensure regulatory coverage and identify gaps

relationshipTerms.name: frameworkContainsControl
relationshipTerms.description: A compliance framework contains multiple compliance controls as its constituent requirements
relationshipTerms.usageExample: MCSB v2 contains NS-1 Network Segmentation control
relationshipTerms.businessMeaning: A framework is composed of its controls
relationshipTerms.constraints: Framework must have at least one control
relationshipTerms.aiAgentUsage: Agents traverse this relationship to enumerate all controls in a framework for assessment

relationshipTerms.name: controlMapsTo
relationshipTerms.description: A compliance control maps to an equivalent control in another framework via a control mapping
relationshipTerms.usageExample: MCSB DP-3 maps to ISO 27001 A.10.1.1
relationshipTerms.usageContext: Use to establish equivalence between controls across frameworks
relationshipTerms.businessMeaning: Satisfying one control demonstrates compliance with mapped controls
relationshipTerms.aiAgentUsage: Agents use mappings to calculate multi-framework compliance scores
relationshipTerms.visualRelationships:
```mermaid
graph LR
    CC1[Control A] -->|mapsTo| CM[Mapping] -->|connectsTo| CC2[Control B]
```
